verses.verse: Now Jephthah<WH3316> the Gileadite<WH1569> was a mighty man<WH1368> of valor<WH2428>, and he was the son<WH1121> of a harlot<WH802>: and Gilead<WH1568> begat<WH3205> Jephthah<WH3316>.

And Gilead<WH1568>'s wife<WH802> bare<WH3205> him sons<WH1121>; and when his wife<WH802>'s sons<WH1121> grew up<WH1431>, they drove out<WH1644> Jephthah<WH3316>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH5157>, Thou shalt not inherit in our father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>; for thou art the son<WH1121> of another<WH312> woman<WH802>.

Then Jephthah<WH3316> fled<WH1272> from<WH6440> his brethren<WH251>, and dwelt<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Tob<WH2897>: and there were gathered<WH3950> vain<WH7386> fellows<WH582> to Jephthah<WH3316>, and they went out with him<WH3318>.
And it came to pass after a while<WH3117>, that the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> made war<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>.

And it was so<WH1121>, that, when the children of Ammon<WH5983> made war<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>, the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> went<WH3212> to fetch<WH3947> Jephthah<WH3316> out of the land<WH776> of Tob<WH2897>;
and they said<WH559> unto Jephthah<WH3316>, Come<WH3212> and be our chief<WH7101>, that we may fight<WH3898> with the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> said<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568>, Did not ye hate<WH8130> me<WH1644>, and drive me out of my father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>? and why are ye come<WH935> unto me now when ye are in distress<WH6887>?

And the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> said<WH559> unto Jephthah<WH3316>, Therefore are we turned again<WH7725> to thee now<WH1980>, that thou mayest go with us<WH3898>, and fight with the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>; and thou shalt be our head<WH7218> over all the inhabitants<WH3427> of Gilead<WH1568>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> said<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568>, If ye bring me home again<WH7725> to fight<WH3898> with the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and Jehovah<WH3068> deliver<WH5414> them before<WH6440> me<WH7218>, shall I be your head?
And the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> said<WH559> unto Jephthah<WH3316>, Jehovah<WH3068> shall be witness<WH8085> between us<WH1697>; surely according to thy word so will we do<WH6213>.

Then Jephthah<WH3316> went<WH3212> with the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568>, and the people<WH5971> made<WH7760> him head<WH7218> and chief<WH7101> over them<WH3316>: and Jephthah spake<WH1696> all his words<WH1697> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068> in Mizpah<WH4709>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, saying<WH559>, What hast thou to do with me<WH935>, that thou art come unto me to fight<WH3898> against my land<WH776>?

And the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> answered<WH559> unto the messengers<WH4397> of Jephthah<WH3316>, Because Israel<WH3478> took away<WH3947> my land<WH776>, when he came up<WH5927> out of Egypt<WH4714>, from the Arnon<WH769> even unto the Jabbok<WH2999>, and unto the Jordan<WH3383>: now therefore restore those lands again<WH7725> peaceably<WH7965>.
And Jephthah<WH3316> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> again<WH3254> unto the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>;
and he said<WH559> unto him<WH559>, Thus saith Jephthah<WH3316>: Israel<WH3478> took not away<WH3947> the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, nor the land<WH776> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>,
but when they came up<WH5927> from Egypt<WH4714>, and Israel<WH3478> went<WH3212> through the wilderness<WH4057> unto the Red<WH5488> Sea<WH3220>, and came<WH935> to Kadesh<WH6946>;

then Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto the king<WH4428> of Edom<WH123>, saying<WH559>, Let me<WH5674>, I pray thee, pass through thy land<WH776>; but the king<WH4428> of Edom<WH123> hearkened<WH8085> not<WH7971>. And in like manner he sent unto the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>; but he would<WH14> not<WH3478>: and Israel abode<WH3427> in Kadesh<WH6946>.

Then they went through<WH3212> the wilderness<WH4057>, and went around<WH5437> the land<WH776> of Edom<WH123>, and the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, and came<WH935> by the east side<WH4217> of the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, and they encamped<WH2583> on the other side<WH5676> of the Arnon<WH769>; but they came<WH935> not within the border<WH1366> of Moab<WH4124>, for the Arnon<WH769> was the border<WH1366> of Moab<WH4124>.

And Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of the Amorites<WH567>, the king<WH4428> of Heshbon<WH2809>; and Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto him<WH5674>, Let us pass, we pray thee<WH776>, through thy land unto<WH5704> my place<WH4725>.

But Sihon<WH5511> trusted<WH539> not Israel<WH3478> to pass<WH5674> through his border<WH1366>; but Sihon<WH5511> gathered<WH622> all his people<WH5971> together<WH622>, and encamped<WH2583> in Jahaz<WH3096>, and fought<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>.

And Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, delivered<WH5414> Sihon<WH5511> and all his people<WH5971> into the hand<WH3027> of Israel<WH3478>, and they smote<WH5221> them<WH3478>: so Israel possessed<WH3423> all the land<WH776> of the Amorites<WH567>, the inhabitants<WH3427> of that country<WH776>.
And they possessed<WH3423> all the border<WH1366> of the Amorites<WH567>, from the Arnon<WH769> even unto the Jabbok<WH2999>, and from the wilderness<WH4057> even unto the Jordan<WH3383>.
So now Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, hath dispossessed<WH3423> the Amorites<WH567> from before<WH6440> his people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, and shouldest thou possess them<WH3423>?

Wilt not thou possess<WH3423> that which Chemosh<WH3645> thy god<WH430> giveth thee to possess<WH3423>? So whomsoever Jehovah<WH3068> our God<WH430> hath dispossessed<WH3423> from before<WH6440> us<WH3423>, them will we possess.

And now art thou anything better<WH2896> than Balak<WH1111> the son<WH1121> of Zippor<WH6834>, king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>? did he ever<WH7378> strive<WH7378> against Israel<WH3478>, or did he ever<WH7378> fight against them<WH3898>?

While Israel<WH3478> dwelt<WH3427> in Heshbon<WH2809> and its towns<WH1323>, and in Aroer<WH6177> and its towns<WH1323>, and in all the cities<WH5892> that are along by the side<WH3027> of the Arnon<WH769>, three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> years<WH8141>; wherefore did ye not recover<WH5337> them within that time<WH6256>?

I therefore have not sinned<WH2398> against thee<WH6213>, but thou doest me wrong<WH7451> to war<WH3898> against me<WH3068>: Jehovah, the Judge<WH8199>, be judge<WH8199> this day<WH3117> between the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> and the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.
Howbeit the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> hearkened<WH8085> not unto the words<WH1697> of Jephthah<WH3316> which he sent him<WH7971>.

Then the Spirit<WH7307> of Jehovah<WH3068> came upon Jephthah<WH3316>, and he passed over<WH5674> Gilead<WH1568> and Manasseh<WH4519>, and passed over<WH5674> Mizpeh<WH4708> of Gilead<WH1568>, and from Mizpeh<WH4708> of Gilead<WH1568> he passed over<WH5674> unto the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.
And Jephthah<WH3316> vowed<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, If thou wilt indeed<WH5414> deliver<WH5414> the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> into my hand<WH3027>,

then it shall be<WH3318>, that whatsoever cometh forth<WH3318> from the doors<WH1817> of my house<WH1004> to meet<WH7125> me<WH7725>, when I return in peace<WH7965> from the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, it shall be Jehovah<WH3068>'s, and I will offer it up<WH5927> for a burnt-offering<WH5930>.
So Jephthah<WH3316> passed over<WH5674> unto the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> to fight<WH3898> against them<WH3068>; and Jehovah delivered<WH5414> them into his hand<WH3027>.

And he smote<WH5221> them from Aroer<WH6177> until thou come<WH935> to Minnith<WH4511>, even twenty<WH6242> cities<WH5892>, and unto<WH58> Abel-cheramim<WH3754>, with a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> slaughter<WH4347>. So the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> were subdued<WH3665> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> came<WH935> to Mizpah<WH4709> unto his house<WH1004>; and<WH1323>, behold, his daughter came out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> him with timbrels<WH8596> and with dances<WH4246>: and she was his only child<WH3173>; besides her he had neither son<WH1121> nor<WH176> daughter<WH1323>.

And it came to pass<WH7200>, when he saw her<WH7167>, that he rent his clothes<WH899>, and said<WH559>, Alas<WH162>, my daughter<WH1323>! thou hast brought<WH3766> me very<WH3766> low<WH3766>, and thou art one of them that trouble<WH5916> me<WH6475>; for I have opened my mouth<WH6310> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and I cannot<WH3201> go back<WH7725>.

And she said<WH559> unto him<WH1>, My father, thou hast opened<WH6475> thy mouth<WH6310> unto Jehovah<WH3068>; do<WH6213> unto me according to that which<WH834> hath proceeded<WH3318> out of thy mouth<WH6310>, forasmuch<WH310> as Jehovah<WH3068> hath taken<WH6213> vengeance<WH5360> for thee on thine enemies<WH341>, even on the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.

And she said<WH559> unto her father<WH1>, Let this thing<WH1697> be done<WH6213> for me<WH7503>: let me alone two<WH8147> months<WH2320>, that I may depart<WH3212> and go down<WH3381> upon the mountains<WH2022>, and bewail<WH1058> my virginity<WH1331>, I and my companions<WH7464>.

And he said<WH559>, Go<WH3212>. And he sent her away<WH7971> for two<WH8147> months<WH2320>: and she departed<WH3212>, she and her companions<WH7464>, and bewailed<WH1058> her virginity<WH1331> upon the mountains<WH2022>.

And it came to pass at the end<WH7093> of two<WH8147> months<WH2320>, that she returned<WH7725> unto her father<WH1>, who did<WH6213> with her according to his vow<WH5088> which he had vowed<WH5087>: and she knew<WH3045> not man<WH376>. And it was a custom<WH2706> in Israel<WH3478>,

that the daughters<WH1323> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH3212> yearly<WH3117> to celebrate<WH8567> the daughter<WH1323> of Jephthah<WH3316> the Gileadite<WH1569> four<WH702> days<WH3117> in a year<WH8141>.
